Grayclicks

A python script to click photos from webcam and save it as a grayscale image

Download this project as a .zip file Download this project as a tar.gz file

Description:

Recently, I was working on an image processing project in which we needed many pictures of a person in grayscale. What we did was:
1. Click photos using the default webcam app 2. Run the python script which takes the filename as argument, converts it to grayscale image and saves it 3. Repeat for mutiple images It was too repetitive and unnecessary. So, I wrote this python which will capture and save the image in grayscale directly from the live webcam feed. 

$ python grayclicks.py

Have python-2.7, opencv2 and numpy installed in prior.

$ sudo apt-get install python-opencv2
$ sudo apt-get install python-numpy

Known Bugs

Hitting 'q' doesn't quit the window most of the times. You have to click on the terminal and press "ctrl+c"
